owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.validityDays: how long the signer will be valid starting from the moment of registration

returns.validUntil: the timestamp in seconds after which the signer expires

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._manager: the address that will be authorized to add and remove signers (use address 0 to disable)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

returns._0: true if the attestation is valid, reverts otherwise

params.encodedData: the EIP712-encoded struct data to be verified (32 bytes long members, hashed dynamic types)
params.signature: the signature of the hashed struct
params.typeHash: the EIP712 type hash for the struct data to be verified

returns._0: true if the signature is valid, reverts otherwise

registerAndRevoke(address,address,uint25.notice: Convenience function for the workflow where one expects a single active signer

setManager(address).notice: Delegates the signer management to another address

verify((address,address,uint256,uint256).notice: Verifies the given attestationThis method does not increment the nonce so it provides no replay safety

Verifies arbitrary typed dataThis method does not increment the nonce so it provides no replay safetyThe attestation SHOULD be part of the encodedData (i.e. a change in the attestation should change the signature)
